text.p: Portuguese bonds strengthened after Wednesday's losses in line with the firmer European trend with the market focussed on domestic and U.S. consumer price inflation figures.
Portuguese July inflation data, due at 1000 GMT, was expected to show a year-on-year rise of 1.7-1.8 percent, little changed from June.
Dealers said this would have limited impact on bond prices since the market would wait for the U.S. number, due at 1230 GMT, which is expected to confirm the low inflation trend.
"We're rallying after yesterday's fall. The market is bullish about the U.S. inflation figure, which will be the main factor in trading today," said one dealer.
"We think the Federal Reserve will keep rates unchanged next week and this should boost 10-year bonds, but since the domestic market has little liquidity we won't make significant gains," he said.
